meanings.definition: Crunk (adjective): Excited or full of energy.
meanings.sent1: The kids were crunk about the upcoming field trip.
meanings.sent2: She always gets crunk when her favorite song comes on.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was so crunk after playing fetch in the park.
meanings.sent4: The city streets were crunk with the hustle and bustle of daily life.
meanings.sent5: The carnival was a crunk celebration of lights, music, and laughter.

meanings.definition: Crunk (verb): To get hyped or turn up.
meanings.sent1: Let's crunk up the party with some dance music!
meanings.sent2: They crunked all night long at the club.
meanings.sent3: The team crunked before the big game to boost their spirits.
meanings.sent4: The crowd crunked up as the concert began.
meanings.sent5: The atmosphere was crunk with excitement as the countdown started.

meanings.definition: Crunk (noun): A style of hip-hop music characterized by its energetic beats and aggressive lyrics.
meanings.sent1: She loves to dance to crunk music at the club.
meanings.sent2: The party was bumping with crunk tunes all night.
meanings.sent3: The crunk blaring from the car speakers made everyone stop and stare.
meanings.sent4: His lyrics were as crunk as the beats in his latest track.
meanings.sent5: The crunk performance left the audience cheering for an encore.
